history.proof: intros pre p post H. intros e H'. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment pre : E.Env -> Type p : ImpProg post : Pred H : pre |= synt_wp p post e : E.Env H' : pre e Unable to unify "(fix synt_wp (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) {struct prog} : Pred := fun e : E.Env => match prog with | Iskip => post e | @Iset A x expr => post (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e) | Iif cond p1 p2 => (E.eval cond e = true -> synt_wp p1 post e) /\\ (E.eval cond e = false -> synt_wp p2 post e) | Iseq p1 p2 => synt_wp p1 (synt_wp p2 post) e | Iwhile cond p => exists inv : Pred, inv e /\\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = false -> post e') /\\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = true -> synt_wp p inv e') end) p post ?M1478" with "exec e p |= post".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (pre : E.Env -> Type) (p : ImpProg) (post : Pred), pre |= synt_wp p post -> pre |= p {=post =}

Premises:
Inductive ImpProg : Type := Iskip : ImpProg | Iset : forall A : Type, E.Var A -> E.Expr A -> ImpProg | Iif : E.Expr bool -> ImpProg -> ImpProg -> ImpProg | Iseq : ImpProg -> ImpProg -> ImpProg | Iwhile : E.Expr bool -> ImpProg -> ImpProg Arguments Iset [A]%type_scope
synt_wp = fix synt_wp (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) {struct prog} : Pred := fun e : E.Env => match prog with | Iskip => post e | @Iset A x expr => post (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e) | Iif cond p1 p2 => (E.eval cond e = true -> synt_wp p1 post e) /\ (E.eval cond e = false -> synt_wp p2 post e) | Iseq p1 p2 => synt_wp p1 (synt_wp p2 post) e | Iwhile cond p => exists inv : Pred, inv e /\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = false -> post e') /\ (forall e' : E.Env, inv e' -> E.eval cond e' = true -> synt_wp p inv e') end : ImpProg -> Pred -> Pred
Pred = E.Env -> Prop : Type
wp_complete : forall (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred), prog {=post =} |= synt_wp prog post
wp_sound : forall (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred), synt_wp prog post |= prog {=post =}
synt_wp_monotonic : forall (p : ImpProg) (post1 post2 : Pred), post1 |= post2 -> synt_wp p post1 |= synt_wp p post2
wlp = fun (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) (e : E.Env) => exec e prog |= post : ImpProg -> Pred -> Pred
Inductive exec : E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env ->...-> exec e (Iseq p1 p2) e'' | exec_Iwhile : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), exec e (Iif cond (Iseq p (Iwhile cond p)) Iskip) |= exec e (Iwhile cond p) Arguments exec_Iset [A]%type_scope Arguments exec_Iif [e] _ _ _ [e'] Arguments exec_Iseq [e p1 p2 e' e''] Arguments exec_Iwhile [e cond p e']
ssrbool.SimplPred = fun (T : Type) (p : ssrbool.pred T) => ssrfun.SimplFun p : ssrbool.pred |= ssrbool.simpl_pred Arguments ssrbool.SimplPred {T}%type_scope
exec_ind : forall P : E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env -> Prop, (forall e : E.Env, P e Iskip e) -> (forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e)) -> (forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (Iif cond p1 p2) e') ->...-> forall (e : E.Env) (i : ImpProg), exec e i |= P e i
exec_sind : forall P : E.Env -> ImpProg -> E.Env -> SProp, (forall e : E.Env, P e Iskip e) -> (forall (A : Type) (e : E.Env) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P e (Iset x expr) (E.upd x (E.eval expr e) e)) -> (forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) e' -> P e (Iif cond p1 p2) e') ->...-> forall (e : E.Env) (i : ImpProg), exec e i |= P e i
wp = fun (prog : ImpProg) (post : Pred) (e : E.Env) => exists e' : E.Env, exec e prog e' /\ post e' : ImpProg -> Pred -> Pred
exec_Iwhile : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), exec e (Iif cond (Iseq p (Iwhile cond p)) Iskip) |= exec e (Iwhile cond p)
E.upd : forall A : Type, E.Var A -> A -> E.Env -> E.Env
ImpProg_ind : forall P : ImpProg -> Prop, P Iskip -> (forall (A : Type) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P (Iset x expr)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 : ImpProg), P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iif cond p1 p2)) -> (forall p1 : ImpProg, P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iseq p1 p2)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), P p -> P (Iwhile cond p)) -> forall i : ImpProg, P i
ImpProg_rect : forall P : ImpProg -> Type, P Iskip -> (forall (A : Type) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P (Iset x expr)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 : ImpProg), P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iif cond p1 p2)) -> (forall p1 : ImpProg, P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iseq p1 p2)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), P p -> P (Iwhile cond p)) -> forall i : ImpProg, P i
ImpProg_rec : forall P : ImpProg -> Set, P Iskip -> (forall (A : Type) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P (Iset x expr)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 : ImpProg), P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iif cond p1 p2)) -> (forall p1 : ImpProg, P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iseq p1 p2)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), P p -> P (Iwhile cond p)) -> forall i : ImpProg, P i
ImpProg_sind : forall P : ImpProg -> SProp, P Iskip -> (forall (A : Type) (x : E.Var A) (expr : E.Expr A), P (Iset x expr)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 : ImpProg), P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iif cond p1 p2)) -> (forall p1 : ImpProg, P p1 -> forall p2 : ImpProg, P p2 -> P (Iseq p1 p2)) -> (forall (cond : E.Expr bool) (p : ImpProg), P p -> P (Iwhile cond p)) -> forall i : ImpProg, P i
Inductive clos_trans_1n (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t1n_step : R x |= Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x | t1n_trans : forall y z : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_trans _%type_scope
E.eval : forall A : Type, E.Expr A -> E.Env -> A
BinNat.N.lt_ind_rel : forall R : Relation_Definitions.relation BinNums.N, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq iff)) R -> (forall m : BinNums.N, R BinNums.N0 (BinNat.N.succ m)) -> (forall n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt n m -> R n m -> R (BinNat.N.succ n) (BinNat.N.succ m)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt n |= R n
Ring_theory.C_setoid_Reflexive : forall C : Type, RelationClasses.Equivalence |= RelationClasses.Reflexive
Zorder.Zmult_le_compat_r : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 p -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.mul n p) (BinInt.Z.mul m p)
BinInt.Z.add_le_mono : forall n m p q : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> BinInt.Z.le p q -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.add n p) (BinInt.Z.add m q)
BinNat.N.add_le_mono : forall n m p q : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le n m -> BinNat.N.le p q -> BinNat.N.le (BinNat.N.add n p) (BinNat.N.add m q)
Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (c : C) (lm : list (R * BinNums.positive)), req (Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos rI cI ceqb phi mkpow mkmult_pow c lm) (rmul (phi c) (Ring_polynom.r_list_pow rI rmul lm))
Ring_polynom.mkadd_mult_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (rP : R) (c : C) (lm : list (R * BinNums.positive)), req (Ring_polynom.mkadd_mult rI radd rsub cI ceqb phi get_sign mkpow mkmult_pow rP c lm) (radd rP (rmul (phi c) (Ring_polynom.r_list_pow rI rmul lm)))
exec_Iseq : forall (e : E.Env) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' e'' : E.Env), exec e p1 e' -> exec e' p2 e'' -> exec e (Iseq p1 p2) e''
exec_Iif_false : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), E.eval cond e = false -> exec e p2 e' -> exec e (Iif cond p1 p2) e'
exec_Iif_true : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg) (e' : E.Env), E.eval cond e = true -> exec e p1 e' -> exec e (Iif cond p1 p2) e'
Ring_theory.morph_opp : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x))
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => BinPosDef.Pos.add y (BinNums.xO (mul p y)) | BinNums.xO p => BinNums.xO (mul p y) | BinNums.xH => y end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
ssrbool.inPhantom : forall p : Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop p
Ring_theory.morph_eq : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall x y : C, ceqb x y = true -> req (phi x) (phi y)
Ring_theory.sign_spec : forall (C : Type) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (get_sign : C -> option C), Ring_theory.sign_theory copp ceqb get_sign -> forall c c' : C, get_sign c = Some c' -> ceqb c (copp c') = true
BinPos.Pos.add_comm : forall p q : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.add p q = BinPos.Pos.add q p
Ring_polynom.ropp_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req req) ropp
Ring_theory.ARsub_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (rsub x y) (radd x (ropp y))
Ring_polynom.rmul_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rmul
Ring_polynom.radd_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) radd
Ring_theory.ARopp_mul_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (ropp (rmul x y)) (rmul (ropp x) y)
exec_Iif : forall (e : E.Env) (cond : E.Expr bool) (p1 p2 : ImpProg), exec e (if E.eval cond e then p1 else p2) |= exec e (Iif cond p1 p2)
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
```intros pre p post H. unfold synt_wp, entails. intros e H'. apply H. assumption.```

original: intros pre p post H. unfold synt_wp, entails. intros e H'. apply H. auto.
